definition: (myth.) peaches of immortality, kept by Xi Wangmu/fresh or confectionery peaches offered as a birthday gift

sentences.english: The peaches in his paintings are always in even number, meaning that good things always come in double.
sentences.chinese: 壽桃的數量也是畫雙不畫單，包含了好事成雙的寓意。

sentences.english: And for old people, we'll prepare Longevity Peaches.
sentences.chinese: 如果是給老人過生日，就要準備壽桃。

definition: ribbon (as a decoration)/cordon (diagonal belt worn as a sign of office or honor)
(bird species of China) common pheasant (Phasianus colchicus)
lit. (may you) have abundance year after year/(an auspicious saying for the Lunar New Year)
calabash or bottle gourd (Lagenaria siceraria)/hoist/generic term for block and tackle (or parts thereof)/muddled/(poker) full house
to offer birthday congratulations (to an elderly person)
ushering in wealth and prosperity (idiom and traditional greeting, esp. at New Year); We wish you wealth and success!
living spirit, living image (idiom); true to life/vivid and realistic
